name: Melissa Fisher
nomination_text: Melissa has given her time to help the testing community by reviewing CVs and helping those who need to discuss all things testing

name: José Diaz
nomination_text: José aka Pepe is using the video series 'Pepes Bar' to share deep conversations with members of the agile and testing community. This is a great way to get to know both José and his guests better

name: Petros Plakogiannis
nomination_text: He supports testing community by organizing events, by participating in conferences in order to share his knowledge and experience on several aspects of testing

name: Petros Plakogiannis
nomination_text: Petros is a super active member and is constantly encouraging people to contribute to the testing community and open source projects.

name: Petros Plakogiannis
nomination_text: Runs the successful Ministry of Test Athens

name: Manoj Kumar
nomination_text: Went above and beyond recently. Showed up and bought his fantastic energy and commitment to the testing community even though other aspects of life were very challenging.

name: Paul Holland
nomination_text: Because he created awesome material on Product and Release Coverage Outlines!

name: Lewis Prescott
nomination_text: Lewis is giving so much back to the testing community and really helping teams to adopt better testing practices like pact

name: Huib Schoots
nomination_text: He is a good tester, also a friend. He are trying to help the test community understand what testing is.

name: Conrad Braam
nomination_text: For being a kind and helpful to other people, and for being an MoT Club addict!

name: Benjamin Schatzmann
nomination_text: Three months ago, Beni was still a financing consultant. Today he oversees the full test automation stack for a critical blood banking system. He inspires his team members, works tirelessly to ensure customer success and support the local testing community at networking events.

name: Asya Bar-Ziv
nomination_text: Asya lives and breathes the modern testing principles and is an incredibly valued team member. We're going through a period of change, and Asya has adapted while helping us improve our test and quality practices.

name: Neil Syrett
nomination_text: For joining Twitter recently! Being a great manager and introducing me to great concepts like zero bug policy

name: Anshita Bhasin
nomination_text: Anshita is one of the best automation developers I have ever seen and worked with. She is amazingly great in Selenium, Cypress and API backend automation and having a great knowledge on E-commerce domain. I really learnt some amazing concepts of GitHub actions and other CI CD cloud infrastructure setup from her blogs. I have seen her work and knowledge in the form of his blogs, post and content sharing.

name: Chris Chant
nomination_text: For being a most wonderful human being and host of LLEWT.

name: Elizabeth Zagroba
nomination_text: for consistently writing excellent blog posts

name: Omprakash Chavan
nomination_text: Omprakash has been one of the few folks who shares some amazing and meaningful insights related to test automation that are rarely touched upon by others in the test automation training space. His contributions definitely need to be celebrated.

name: Sayali Kulkarni
nomination_text: Her contribution to 'The Library of Testing' is commendable. Collating and organizing the needs of Testers in one place.

name: Erika Chestnut
nomination_text: Leaders deserve praise too and Erika Chestnut, Head of Quality & Process Engineering at Thrasio is exceptional. From scaling teams, quality software, and driving process, she is an exceptional speaker and shares her years of leadership on the global stage and in leadership coaching. The best!

name: Linda Lačić
nomination_text: For doing awesome work at Officient.io, changing the status quo and making everyone's work even better, day after day. Keep it up!

name: Shweta sharma
nomination_text: As said by Richard Feynman 'The ultimate test of your knowledge is your capacity to convey it to another.' and she is great at doing that. She is a leader we all look up to & always available to guide us and be there for us.

name: Shweta Sharma
nomination_text: From having knowledge sharing as a KPI for her large teams to being an advocate for mental wellness to scaling quality at Axelerant, this is a leader that all can learn from.

name: Joe Colantonio
nomination_text: What can we say about Joe? From sharing testing industry news every week to hosting the TestGuild podcast to celebrating rising leaders at AutomationGuild, Joe has been a tireless resource for test automation, functional and non-functional.

name: Amruta Pawar
nomination_text: She loves the challenges in automation and always tries hard to makes the framework easier and more efficient.

name: Amel Krupalija
nomination_text: For being a great co-worker for pair testing and for always being cheerful!

name: Michał Krzyżanowski
nomination_text: Thank you for actively including first-time conference attendees, making them feel welcome and that they belong. It can mean a world to someone.

name: Mukta Sharma
nomination_text: She is a good human and rising star of the testing community. Her passion for learning & sharing is contagious! I think everyone appreciates what she contributes with her posts from daily dose of motivation to something new on QA topics. If you haven’t, you should definitely connect with her!

name: Christian Baumann
nomination_text: His talk at ExpoQA provided crucial details about programming foundations which will help both new and experienced programmers improve their skills and develop better automated tests.

name: Chrishan Perera
nomination_text: Thanks for reminding us to embrace chaos when we see it, to take action and try something differently, and that something beautiful can come out of it. We need more people like you!

name: Kat Jaworska
nomination_text: For creating an automated test for a service her team looks after in her spare time. Then working with her team to have the Pull Request reviewed collaboratively,  learning about the things that dev's look for in a review and getting it merged. This allows for all her team's sanity tests to be executed using automated tests, providing faster feedback and a reduction in effort! A fantastic effort, paving the way for future work in this area!

name: Oliver Verver
nomination_text: Oliver always works with the tester in the team to improve the testing together. In his last job, he helped the tester set up an automation framework. Apart from automation, he has also made efforts to learn about exploratory testing. He knows that testing is a combination of automation and exploration. He also firmly believes in the boy scout rule 'leave code better than you found it', this improves technical quality of whatever he's working on!

name: Sophie Küster
nomination_text: Sophie gave an awesome talk at EuroSTAR, it was so good that it was voted to be given again so that those who missed it could have a chance to see it.

name: Rick Tracy
nomination_text: For his ExpoQA talk where he discussed the challenges testers face when pressured to achieve perfection. In his talk, he provided alternative options to dealing with imperfection, and encouraged us to aim to achieve an acceptable state of imperfect.

name: Julia Durán
nomination_text: Julia recently spoke at her first international conference(Romanian Testing Conference) and did it English rather than her native Spanish. The talk is of value to testers who are switching from management back to an Individual contributor or anyone who is job hunting.

name: Brandon Jason Valle Tamayo
nomination_text: Thank you for sharing your story of building a developer-tester relationship, that there's lots of value in acknowledging mistakes and doing better, and what good can come out of collaboration based on mutual respect.

name: Tristan Lombard
nomination_text: I nominate Tristan Lombard as an Honorary Tester of The Day! He may not be a tester in the traditional sense, but he has positively impacted our test community in so many wonderful ways. Tristan lifts others up! He is Stage Mom to many successful test blogs and presentations. He is all inclusive and supports learning and growing in multiple ways. Thank you, Tristan!

name: Tristan Lombard
nomination_text: For being an amazing host and also for always support the community when someone needs help

name: Hilary Weaver-Robb
nomination_text: For all your work to bring people together. Thanks so much for including me in your meetup for research, and sharing your knowledge freely ❤️

name: Mike Talks
nomination_text: Really simple but interactive talk that really got me (and others) thinking.  Really enjoyed it

name: Kyle Potter
nomination_text: Kyle has worked persistently to get our load testing proof of concept up and running. He's also mentoring other members of the team in his own time. He's an all round good egg.

name: Brandon Jason Valle Tamayo
nomination_text: Thank you for sharing your story of building a developer-tester relationship, that there's lots of value in acknowledging mistakes and doing better, and what good can come out of collaboration based on mutual respect.

name: Jo Richards
nomination_text: Jo asks excellent questions that the testing community learn from. Jo has tonnes of useful advice to share about regression testing and much more!

name: Dan Billing
nomination_text: Dan's brilliant talk at ExpoQA on Security Testing has encouraged me to attempt to learn more about the topic, and overcome my own fear that

name: Andrea Jensen
nomination_text: For her inspiring talk at ExpoQA on Ensemble Testing where she demonstrated how the method can be used to encourage improved collaboration between testers, developers and other teams.

name: Tom Young
nomination_text: For reminding me that we sometimes put another on a podium while we're all human. We all have our own struggles, some shared, some different and still we all need to cope with them. Let's start by sharing.

name: Thomas Kuypers
nomination_text: Great leader: always looking for new ways of testing, sharing his knowledge, and encouraging his team members to push them at top level

name: Kimberly Snoyl
nomination_text: Kimberly is a brilliant colleague. Not only for her work for Ladies that UX, her nomination for the EuroSTAR rising star award 2022 and for being a great speaker and accessibility advocate. But for being fun and lovely to work with.

name: Filip Hric
nomination_text: Filip is a Cypress champion! He posts incredibly helpful articles regularly on his blog. He also teaches workshops and courses on Cypress.

name: Constance Armitage
nomination_text: For your kindness in our conversations at AgileTD Open Air 2022 and your amazing drawn summary!

weblinks.name: Drawn summary of AgileTD Open Air 2022 [Twitter Thread]

name: Bastian Knerr
nomination_text: For joining their first conference with AgileTD Open Air 2022, fully embracing the community spirit, and contributing with sharing their own life journey into testing - loved our conversation!

name: Anna Chicu
nomination_text: For reminding us that well done post-mortems can be a powerful tool to build a quality culture and instrumental to continuous improvement.

name: Alex Schladebeck
nomination_text: For daring to ask the really big deep hard-hitting questions, to share them with us, to ask for help, and to share that with us as well.

name: Maryam Umar
nomination_text: For her inspirational TestBash Career talk - 'Getting Back on the Horse After 10 Rejections'. It was real, relatable and fantastic!!!

name: Stu Johnson
nomination_text: Stu has been critical for creating and growing the Quality Community of Practice at our work. He's supported the QA's at our work to do our best work and grow our capabilities.

name: Marie Drake
nomination_text: For creating great, clear videos on git on her new YouTube channel Testing with Marie

name: Marcela State
nomination_text: Marcela does an amazing work in the testing field and currently she manages a large community of testers, helping them grow both on personal levels and professional. From organizing events for open source technologies till working directly with more than 10 different clients from all types of domains, she was performing amazingly all times. She both though others through workshops and debated the future trends of QA Ops at different conferences. So is definitely a role mode!

name: Clare Norman
nomination_text: Reminding us all of the power that comes from not filtering yourself

name: Jennifer Ann Lee
nomination_text: For taking the time to answer all of the questions and helping someone who is wanting to break into the software testing field.

name: Simon Tomes
nomination_text: Simon has been my #1 supporter since DAY 1. First interview, first cheerleader, and one of my first friends here. Thanks for helping us newbies adjust and thrive ❤️

name: Eva Podbrsdká
nomination_text: Eva delivered an impressive talk about Autism. She not only shared her very personal story but also a vast of facts and information on the topic in general. It was very nice to have her with us, volunteering and share her experiences for the company I am working with. Thanks, Eva you certainly have made an impact!!

name: ALADESNAMI DAYO
nomination_text: He's been a great impact in the QA society

name: Lisi Hocke
nomination_text: Thank you to Lisi Hocke for reviewing my chapter in the book 'How  can I test this?'. Lisi's comments were full of useful and constructive comments.

name: Lisi Hocke
nomination_text: Lisi ran a fantastic hands-on remote workshop on ensemble exploratory testing at #GermanTesting Day. The participants learned a lot in a safe space

name: Samuel Nitsche
nomination_text: Technically Samuel is not a tester, but I think he deserves this title as an honorary tester. He does so much to advocate for testing & quality and now he's a keynote speaker, too!

name: Beren Van Daele
nomination_text: For the two blog posts: 'Those Who Failed' and 'Versus the Endboss'. Just what I needed to see today, to share myself from past failings.

name: Anna McDougall
nomination_text: Her talk 'Being an opera singer prepared me for a career in tech' at #GermanTesting Day was a great reminder that changing careers doesn't mean to start from zero. It was also fun and full of insights into both careers in opera and in tech

name: 9 out of 10 testers
nomination_text: A shout out to the creators behind the 9 out of 10 testers YouTube channel. Great work you are doing.  Keep it up!

name: Al Goodall
nomination_text: Al is an amazing Lead Tester in our organisation and has recently instituted automated sanity checks in our production environments, cutting a manual task in half (at least!) and improving our responsiveness to deployment-related issues. Al, you have made our long-held dream a reality and I salute your resilience, determination and drive to get this done!

name: Karen Todd
nomination_text: Karen's YouTube videos exploring Software Testing Advocacy are innovative, interesting and useful.

name: Dimpy Adhikary
nomination_text: She is an expert in Testing both functional/Automation and overall. Her blog  is where she writes some practical advice. She is a detail oriented person. She has started an initiative which will help testers not only in testing or programming but also as on overall from various perspectives not just automation. The kind of questions you will see here would be very much different and shows her insights about testing. A great person to interact in communities. We need more people like who can act as Role Model for the community.

name: Vernon Richards
nomination_text: For learning new skills in public, sharing the results as well as the journey, both equally valuable.

name: Suman Bala
nomination_text: For helping me with the API chapter in our book when I was struggling. She's been very generous with her knowledge and I've learned so much from her.

name: Rita Avota
nomination_text: Rita has made my onboarding experience such a welcoming and positive one. She is infectiously calm and positive, and shares her expertise on a pair or group level for max impact. Keep being awesome Rita!

name: Louise Gibbs
nomination_text: The blogpost 'Testing is an underrated skill in Testing'. It's a good twist on the brief from the Ministry of Testing monthly blog post challenge on underrated skills in testing. Test automation isn't everything - testing is.

weblinks.name: Testing is an underrated skill in testing

name: Karo Stoltzenburg
nomination_text: Karo amazes me every time we work together with her structured approach and the excellent questions she asks and the ideas she comes up with.

name: Francis Bonsu
nomination_text: Very dedicated and determined tester who has over the years been passionate about testing.

name: Dave Clissold
nomination_text: Shoutout to Dave Clissold at THRIVE for working tirelessly to execute our E2E tests in our CI pipelines. His technical knowledge and mentoring is invaluable to the THRIVE Tech Team and wider Cypress community.

name: Ashley Graf
nomination_text: The blogpost 'Why code review is an underrated skill in testing'. I like it to be the first step I take before I start testing. I may not comment, but I definitely read it. I too often regret when I don't.

weblinks.name: Why code review is an underrated skill in testing

name: Nicola Lindgren
nomination_text: For giving me advice on blogging, seo and linking me with people in the community who can help

name: Marta Woźniak-Semeniuk
nomination_text: Book recommendation at Test Bash Leadership - reminding us to read Kahneman's Thinking Fast and slow.

name: Lina Zubyte
nomination_text: The long overdue new #QualityFoundations blog post on Definition of Ready - and there's an article for Definition of Done too. https://qualitybits.tech/writing/definition-of-ready

name: Kika (Kiruthika) Ganesan
nomination_text: For an inspirational talk at TestBash Leadership on Taking the Leap to Leadership. A powerful first talk of hers!

name: Gareth Waterhouse
nomination_text: For returning to testing and becoming Principal Test Engineer at ASOS!

name: Sanne Visser
nomination_text: For improving the craft by bringing people together through organizing the amazing #FrogsConf!

name: Joep Schuurkes
nomination_text: For improving the craft by bringing people together through organizing the amazing #FrogsConf!

name: Huib Schoots
nomination_text: For improving the craft by bringing people together through organizing the amazing #FrogsConf!

name: Elizabeth Zagroba
nomination_text: For improving the craft by bringing people together through organizing the amazing #FrogsConf!

name: Cirilo Wortel
nomination_text: For improving the craft by bringing people together through organizing the amazing #FrogsConf!

name: Patrick Prill
nomination_text: Patrick's test framework is going to be a significant game changer for his team and beyond. I'm really happy to have him in the team, and immensely appreciate his willingness to share knowledge, his insights and attention to detail.

name: Patrick Prill
nominated_by: Nominated by Flávio H. de Freitas
nomination_text: Our grumpy friend! It is a pleasure to have him on the team. He is always helping everyone around, coming with great ideas, and shaking the quality of our process, code and deliverables. Life is definitely more fun with him around. We learn and have fun, while building an amazing product.

name: Petros Plakogiannis
nomination_text: Petros always helps and supports testers around the world with free webinars and trainings! He has 'community first' attitude! Also, as far as I know he help testers to find jobs! This is great because he does all the things in his free time so we salute him!

name: Simon P. Schrijver
nomination_text: Ten year milestone on the 5blogs curation list: The (best) five blogs he read each day. Check them out.

name: Prachi Dahibhate
nomination_text: I know Prachi from last 2 years now and she has done great job. She keep upscaling her as she started doing more about testing trial and error things, she wrote many blogs based on different topics, she got chance to write about testing blog as well as she participated in many testing community competition where she won the several prizes and goodies.

name: Alan Richardson
nomination_text: for his API challenges at https://www.eviltester.com/page/tools/apichallenges/, providing a space to learn about APIs and practice testing them.

name: Eva Podbrdská
nomination_text: for staying in the cancelled #99MinutesChallenge, sharing her approach and helping me to reflect my own solution approach. So wonderful to learn from each other.

name: Stuart Crocker
nomination_text: By chance redefining Quality as: Quality is the absence of unnecessary friction. Making the relative interaction actionable - something we can ask towards: What causes unnecessary friction and work on that. That's where the unspoken requirements hide.

name: Federico Toledo
nomination_text: Fede has always been super helpful in testing community, sharing posts in his site (https://www.federico-toledo.com/), writing the book 'Introduccion a las Pruebas de sistemas de Informacion', sharing his insights in all sort of conferences and webinars, hosting the QualitySense podcast. With his deep and clear insights he is always willing to share and learn about new practices and collaborate.

name: Andrei Guchín
nomination_text: Andrei is a test leader with great experience in performance testing. He has contributed with so many articles and presentations in the topic, in English and Spanish. He has helped many fellow testers to learn and grow in very challenging projects.

name: James Thomas
nomination_text: For your insightful talk 'Exploring with Automation' - absolutely loved your way of sharing knowledge, experience, mindset, and especially how you approach things. Special kudos for giving this talk for students and help them grow!

name: Niranjan Limbachiya
nomination_text: A true leader and passionate tester. He build a software professional network called Testing Tech News. Also he is founder of testing organization called KiwiQA. He is always ready to help you to build your career and provide guidance.

name: Lisi Hocke
nomination_text: Lisi's blog post today about starting her new job inspired me to approach my day differently. She's so generous to share her experiences.

name: Bob Salmon
nomination_text: for writing articles that explain exceptions, Modularisation and Encapsulation for everyone on https://randomtechthoughts.blog/

name: Constance Hermit
nomination_text: For your amazing way of conveying technical knowledge in an accessible manner while representing the variety of people and identities in your illustrations! Most recent example is your Gatling article. We need more like you, thank you so much!

name: Daniel Knott
nomination_text: For creating his YouTube channel, giving people access to clear, distilled information in video format

name: Meg Mackay
nomination_text: The article on 'Choose Your Own Test Adventure: A Strategy Template' https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/choose-your-own-test-adventure-strategy-template-meg-mackay/

weblinks.name: Choose Your Own Test Adventure: A Strategy Template'

name: Ndubuisi Mathew Omegara
nomination_text: For incredible dedication to software testing, continuous self-development and being one of the best bug-hunters we've ever had. Damn fine service to our company and the software industry as a whole. Absolute pleasure to work with!

name: Louise Harney
nomination_text: For openly sharing your reflections on becoming a solo tester and actively asking for feedback and inspiration - you are amazing!

name: Leila Gregory
nomination_text: For your extensive briefing before my new job, for making me feel welcome from day one, for our invaluable experience exchanges, for your trust and kindness. I feel honored to work with you!

name: Bruce Hughes
nomination_text: For the article: Power of Small Goals - the visuals, the honesty and for relating a challenge we all have. We need ways to trick ourselves to achievable actions.

name: Bruce Hughes
nomination_text: Bruce's latest blog post https://undevelopedbruce.com/2022/01/12/the-power-of-small-goals/ reminded me the magic of small steps! Helped me overcome today's attack of imposter syndrome.

name: Vern Richards
nomination_text: Vern has been sharing his thoughts day after day with brilliant thoughts and insights through atomic essays. Top effort and so worth reading. Thanks fella

name: Vernon Richards
nomination_text: For your amazing Typeshare essays - what insightful nuggets of experience and wisdom! Thank you for sharing with all of us.

name: Lena Pejabat Wiberg
nomination_text: Incredible support of other folks in the community

name: Lee Marshall
nomination_text: Since joining the team, Lee has been celebrated in every Review and Retrospective as a positive, shaping member who adds a tremendous amount of value and asks difficult questions. At the same time, maintaining a creative, positive and productive atmosphere. Business Analysts and Developers now ask themselves, 'What would Lee ask here?'

name: James Thomas
nomination_text: I loved his work regarding a latency issue at Ada Health! Thanks so much

name: Patricio Miner
nomination_text: He has a great youtube channel with useful content in Spanish, lots of tutorials, demos and courses, helping many people to break into tech and grow, while having fun with their videos.

name: Craig Morten
nomination_text: Might be the biggest testing advocate at ASOS for quality, his work on accessibility has been amazing and eye opening. He is probably the best TDD Coach we have ever had and he has endless capacity to support and teach others.

name: Áine McGovern
nomination_text: Áine does incredible work supporting the testing community by supporting meetups and sharing tonnes of useful information. She's a cornerstone of the community ❤️

name: Veerle Verhagen
nomination_text: For starting a book club to (re)read Agile Testing Condensed, organizing live chats about the progress and sharing their learnings

name: Samuel Nitsche
nomination_text: For starting a book club to (re)read Agile Testing Condensed, organizing live chats about the progress and sharing their learnings
